alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:33PM EDT until May 10 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. .Recent rain and snowfall have resulted in high water on the East Branch of the Escanaba River at Gwinn. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.9 feet, Water reaches the bottom girder of the M-35 bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:20 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:20 PM EDT Saturday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/17/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
